Veeru Goes to the Circus
Written by Richa Ingle Deo
Grandma and Grandpa take Veeru 
to see the Jumbo-Bumbo Circus. 
"This is going to be fun!" 
he tells them. 
Veeru is very excited 
to see the tightrope walkers, 
the acrobats, the jugglers, 
and the funny red-nosed clown. 
"Wow!" says Veeru, 
again and again. 
That night 
Veeru dreams of having his own circus.  
The next morning 
he invites Mommy, Daddy, 
Grandma and Grandpa 
to 'Veeru’s Circus'. 
Veeru the tightrope walker, 
plans to walk on a high rope. 
"That might not be safe Veeru. 
You may fall down," 
Mommy warns. 
So Veeru the tightrope walker, 
sets the rope on the ground 
and walks on the rope instead. 
Everyone claps. 
"Thank you, thank you," he says. 
Veeru the acrobat, 
plans to jump through a fire-lit ring. 
"That may not be safe Veeru. 
You may burn yourself," 
Daddy warns. 
So Veeru the acrobat, 
takes a hula hoop 
and jumps through it instead. 
Everyone claps. 
And Veeru says, 
"Thanks, thanks."
Veeru the juggler, 
plans to juggle six balls. 
"That might not be safe Veeru. 
The balls may fall on your head," 
warns Grandpa. 
So Veeru the juggler, 
juggles a yummy sweet instead. 
The sweet lands inside his mouth. 
Everyone claps. 
Mmmmmm… thank you very much!" 
he mumbles, 
munching the sweet away. 
Veeru the ring master, 
plans to have a caged lion 
for the trick. 
He has seen pictures 
of a circus lion in a book. 
"It is wrong 
to make a wild animal 
do tricks for us. 
That’s not a good idea. 
The lion might get angry," 
Grandma warns. 
So Veeru the ring master 
shakes hands 
with his pet dog Bozo instead. 
"Thanks Bozo," says Veeru. 
Then Veeru the red-nosed clown, 
shakes his bottom. 
Oh no! His pants fall down. 
Everyone laughs. 
"You were so funny," 
Grandma tells Veeru. 
"What a wonderful circus 
we have seen!" 
say Mommy, Daddy, 
Grandpa and Grandma in chorus.
